Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a plant that has plenty of water and shows signs of health, such as green leaves and upright stems.
The student can illustrate the same type of plant without enough water, showing changes such as wilting or color differences.
The student can demonstrate the plant's need for light by drawing a plant that is exposed to sunlight and looks healthy.
The student can identify and illustrate patterns by comparing a well-watered plant to one that lacks water.
The student can use drawings to show that plants cannot live or grow without water.
